newtask.title: !newtask
newtask.description: This command is responsible for creating a new task by parsing user arguments.The format is **!newtask <starttime> <interval> <repeats> <message>**. The arguments don't have to be supplied in this specific order, although the <message> should appear last.

fields.name: Start Time
fields.value: This arguments specifies the starting time of the task and is provided in the format: 24:00 (If the starting time is earlier than the current time, the task will start tomorrow at this time)

fields.name: Interval
fields.value: This arguments specifies the delay between tasks and is provided in the format 1w2d3h. This will translate into one week, two days, three hours. You can omit unneeded units: 2d is still a valid format.

fields.name: Repeats
fields.value: This arguments specifies how many times should the task be repeated, this is just an integer. If you don't want the task to repeat, just provide 1.

fields.name: Message
fields.value: This is just a message to be printed with the reminder, it's free form text.

fields.name: Example
fields.value: !newtask 15:00 1d 1 Did you remember to plant your radishes?
